newsitem.title: CHILE: Chilean economy grows 3.9 pct in first quarter.
newsitem.headline: Chilean economy grows 3.9 pct in first quarter.

text.p: Chilean economic activity as measured by the Imacec index rose 3.9 percent in the first quarter of 1997 over the first quarter of last year, the Central Bank reported.

The increase, one of the lowest quarterly figures of the past three years, reflected the effects of drought in central Chile and a general slowdown in the rate of economic growth, the Central Bank said in its twice-monthly macroeconomic report.
The Imacec in March rose 3.4 percent, the bank previously announced.

"The March figure was negatively affected, like those in January and February, by the drought which has recently affected much of the country," said the Central Bank's report. The drought has hit agricultural production, especially in the export fruit sector, and electric power generation because of sagging water levels at dams.
If it weren't for the drought, economic growth in the first quarter would have been 4.5 percent, said the report.
The figure also "reflects a path of moderation in the dynamism of economic activity," said the report.
Growth in the mining sector was still leading the rest of the economy, said the report.
"The vigorously dynamic growth in mining production is worth noting, especially in copper, the sector which is leading growth in the economy," said the report.
